authors: Luke Nichols Daily Sun Sports Editor
description: The Beatrice boys basketball team defeated Sidney 74-37 on Saturday to claim the Sidney Holiday Tournament championship. The Orangemen jumped out to an 18-10 lead in the first quarter and...
title: Beatrice boys win holiday tourney
maintext:
The Beatrice boys basketball team defeated Sidney 74-37 on Saturday to claim the Sidney Holiday Tournament championship.
The Orangemen jumped out to an 18-10 lead in the first quarter and led 39-19 at half time. They broke the game open in the third quarter, outscoring Sidney 24-3 to extend their lead to 63-22. They’d coast to the win from there.
Bennett Crandall led the way for Beatrice with 22 points while Andrew Mahoney had 15, Griffen Vater had 11, Devin Smith had nine, Elliott Jurgens had six, Peyton Murphy had five, Jace Pethoud had four and Josiah Wallman had two.
The Orangemen reached the championship by defeating Laramie, Wyo. 59-33 on Friday.
Beatrice took a 16-4 lead in the first quarter and never looked back in the win.
Mahoney had 15 points for Beatrice while Crandall and Jurgens had 12 each. Vater and Smith had six each while Murphy had five and Zack Zimmerman had three.
The Beatrice girls lost to Sidney 39-37 on Saturday in a rematch of last year’s state quarterfinal game.
The game was tied 6-6 after the first quarter and Beatrice led 21-17 at half time. Sidney came back to take a 30-29 lead after three quarters and then outscored Beatrice 9-8 in the final quarter to win 39-37.
The Beatrice boys are now 4-4 on the season and will be in action again Thursday when they travel to York.
Carley Leners led the Lady O with 10 points while Addie Barnard had nine, Hannah Lytle had six, Lexi Schwartz had four, Olivia Aden had three, Mak Hatcliff had two and Nevaeh Martinez had two.
On Friday, in the first round of the Sidney Holiday Tournament, the Lady O defeated Laramie, Wyo. 59-49. Beatrice had a 46-26 lead entering the fourth quarter. Laramie outscored Beatrice 23-13 in the final quarter, but it wasn’t nearly enough.
Hatcliff poured in 25 points for Beatrice while Leners had 16, Schwartz and Barnard had eight each and Morgan Mahoney had two.
The Beatrice girls are now 4-4 on the season and they will host Seward on Friday.
